summary: Nancy's working in Texas, but the kids laugh at her Welsh accent. She's coming home in 6 weeks. Earlier than that she's going to travel with 3 other Brits.

text: Kyle: Who wants to go out for a drink? </s><s> Megan: No, sorry, I'm cleaning the house today. </s><s> Roseanne: You've always loved cleaning, haven't you? I remember how angry you used to get with your brother for leaving a mess in the kitchen. </s><s> Vince: Yeah, she'd always yell at me, even though I was the one in charge when our parents were away. </s><s> Kyle: I don't get why it matters so much whether I clean my flat once a week or once a month. No one died from a bit of dust. </s><s> Megan: Remind me to never stay at your place :P </s><s> Roseanne: I'm somewhere in between. My house is always a mess, but I hate it when it's dirty. </s><s> Vince: What's the difference? </s><s> Roseanne: I can't stand when there's dust, crumbs on the floor etc., so I clean regularly. But I love it when all my stuff just lies around. When I put everything back on shelves or into cabinets, I keep on getting mad that I have to look for it, get up and take it out, and generally lose so much time. I like to have everything within my reach. </s><s> Vince: There's no better wardrobe than the armchair, right? XD </s><s> Kyle: I prefer the floor. There's more space on it :D </s><s> Megan: Just reading this gives me the creeps. </s><s> Kyle: Fine, go back to cleaning, we'll think of you while sharing a beer :D </s><s> Roseanne: Hey, I never said I can come. My hubby's away this weekend, so I have no one to leave the kids with ;( </s><s> Vince: Take them to Megan's place, they can help her clean :D </s><s> Megan: You know what? I don't care. I can watch your kids, Roseanne. Just bring them over. </s><s> Roseanne: But are you serious or just mad at us? </s><s> Megan: No, I'm serious. I like your kids. And they're nice enough that if I ask them to do something, they actually do it :D </s><s> Roseanne: LOL, okay. Actually, I think that when I tell them to go and help aunt Meg with cleaning, they'll think it's fun. </s><s> Vince: And when you tell them to clean their own rooms, they say you're a monster? :D </s><s> Roseanne: Exactly. But Bill for example always cleans the windows at my parents house. They don't even need to ask anymore, he simply knows it's his job. </s><s> Kyle: Do they pay him? :P </s><s> Roseanne: Well, sometimes. But still I think he likes doing it. I don't know, maybe it's because no one checks if he did it well, he's just left alone to do his thing, so he feels like a man in the house in a way? </s><s> Megan: Tell them I can pay with cookies if they help me. </s><s> Roseanne: The famous chocolate cookies? </s><s> Megan: Why not? I'm feeling generous today :D </s><s> Roseanne: Guys, I think I'm gonna change my mind about that beer. Meg, would you accept one more helper? :D </s><s> Megan: You're always welcome! But sorry boys, it's going to be a “girls only” event (except for little Billy). Otherwise my house will never get cleaned today :D
summary: Roseanne wanted to go out for a beer with Kyle and Vince, and leave her kids with Megan.  Megan will clean the house and give Roseanne's kids her famous chocolate cookies if they help, what made Roseanne change her mind, and she wants to join them.

text: Isabel: Hello, my name is Isabel, I have received your reservation. I'd like to confirm the details. Please send me a message whenever you are able to confirm your arrival. </s><s> Christian: Hi Isabel, thank you for your message, please tell me what kind of information do you need </s><s> Isabel: First of all, I need full names of all guests </s><s> Isabel: And your passport of ID numbers. What time are you arriving in Madrid? </s><s> Christian: 21:20 at barajas airport </s><s> Isabel: Please let me know when you arrive. The best way to get to the apartment is to take the metro line 8 to the center, then change to line 10 at Nuevos Ministerios, and then line 1 at Tribunal. Your station is Antón Martin. How much time do we need to get to the apartment? </s><s> Isabel: I think that about 30 minutes.  </s><s> Christian: We will have to wait for the luggage and get to the station but I really hope we arrive to the center around 22:00... </s><s> Isabel: No problem, I will be waiting for you with the keys, I live next door :) </s><s> Isabel: Door 14 </s><s> Christian: That's great, I will text you when we are at Anton Martin </s><s> Isabel: Please tell me how many towels do you need. summary: Christian made a reservation with Isabel and he needs to send her passport details of the guests. Cristian arrives in Madrid at 21:20. It takes 30 minutes to go from the barajas airport to the apartment by metro. The end station is Antón Martin. Isabel lives next door, at number 14.

text: Max: So it seems like we're finally getting ourselves a car. </s><s> George: Whoa, for real? Sweet, I know you've wanted one for a while. What make? </s><s> Max: Oh, a Toyota. Nothing beats the comfort and freedom, really. </s><s> Max: Yeah, I'm trying to convince her to get a licence, too. I don't want her to feel like I'm only doing this for myself. summary: Max and Sylvia are getting a Toyota, because they are fed up with public transport. Sylvia was against it at first but she gave in. Max wants her to get a licence so that they both can drive.

text: Oliver: I think I should stop reading the rules after we already played a game </s><s> Oliver: found two things we were doing wrong today </s><s> Chris: maybe it shows that you should keep reading them </s><s> Chris: so what we were doing wrong? </s><s> Oliver: first the basic follow-up only gives you temp influence and not the permanent one (so my whole strategy for the day was basically based on a wrong rule :P) </s><s> Oliver: and second, you only get the income for the resources you own (tokens on top) and not for everything you have access to </s><s> Chris: the map had full symbol drawn for the action so I also thought it was permanent influence </s><s> Chris: had no idea about the second one </s><s> Emily: the second rule means money would be much more sparse </s><s> Oliver: well yes but it gives you a reason to build an already existing building again </s><s> Oliver: with the rules we played with there was no sense in doing that </s><s> Emily: true </s><s> Emily: yet another game we need to play again with the right rules ;) </s><s> Oliver: additionally during the vote phase, if there is a draw the first decision is taken by the player with the least amount of points and not the closest to the player initiating the vote </s><s> Chris: makes sense </s><s> Chris: but I'm not sure about the income phase, it's written that you get income for import </s><s> Olivier: well yes but technically the import action is building your own buildings </s><s> Oliver: so no matter how you look at it with import you'll always be on top with your token and get the income </s><s> Chris: right </s><s> Chris: well just like Emily said we need to play this again </s><s> Emily: we can always do it during the next meeting </s><s> Oliver: as usual I'm up for anything </s><s> Oliver: but if we'll play a new game, let me read the rules first :P
summary: Oliver found out that they misunderstood the rules of the game. Emily and Chris think they should play the game again.

text: Fran: so how's the new affair going?;) </s><s> Sally: hmm </s><s> Fran: what happened? </s><s> Sally: I'm not sure. I mean everything is fine but there's no chemistry. Maybe there's something wrong with me </s><s> Fran: There's nothing wrong with you. Don't let yourself think that. Maybe you just need more time </s><s> Sally: It's not like I wanna give up but sometimes I wonder if I should be forcing myself </s><s> Fran: Definitely not. But maybe try not to put so much pressure on it </s><s> Sally: I just don't understand it. And myself </s><s> Fran: You don't have to understand anything :) </s><s> Sally: I mean there was definitely a spark at the beginning and now I really don't know what happened and how to get it back </s><s> Fran: You probably started thinking too much ;) </s><s> Sally: Hahah probably. My head is my worst enemy </s><s> Fran: You just met, don't force it. Why would you want chemistry that just dies out after 3 months? Maybe deep down you're looking for something more serious or stable and that's why you actually don't wanna rush it? And you're older now. It's more difficult to fall madly in love when you are not so easily fooled anymore ;) </s><s> Sally: I get it. It's not even about falling in love. I just don't get what happened. I mean I can't be in a relationship with absolutely no chemistry at all </s><s> Fran: Well it went away so maybe it will come back :D You can't overthink those things. They don't like it ;) </s><s> Sally: I probably am overthinking. We had a heart to heart and I feel much better after the talk </s><s> Fran: You want soulmates, intellectual connection, and chemistry - that's some high expectations for a new relation. Not everything at once </s><s> Sally: Yeah I would but I know I can't have it all </s><s> Fran: Of course you can. But some things work better overtime. On the other hand, do NOT force yourself into anything.  </s><s> Sally: I'm not going to. I guess I've been lucky I found someone who is understanding and wants to discuss things </s><s> Fran: Exactly. And once you feel safer, chemistry might come back, because you won't be analyzing and thinking and worrying and pressuring yourself ;) </s><s> Sally: You're probably right.
summary: Sally doesn't feel the chemistry in her new relationship anymore. Fran suggests that Sally is overthinking the situation and that Sally should give the relationship some time.

text: Beryl: Hello guys! How are you doing? We've lost contact for a few months now. Hope you are well. </s><s> Anton: A happy hello to you Beryl! Great to hear from you. We are fine, thanks. Do you know exactly when you'll be coming? </s><s> Beryl: Not so much. Can I get back to you in 2, 3 days' time? </s><s> Anton: ASAP really. As I say we've been receiving bookings daily now. </s><s> Beryl: Well, no big deal. I'll be staying in Cape Town for a longer time and am quite flexible in my dates. </s><s> Anton: Will you be coming with Tino, if I may ask? </s><s> Beryl: No. I am single again. Hurray! Greetings to you both! </s><s> Anton: Take care!
summary: Beryl will be staying in Anton's airbnb in Onrus from 4th January until 12th January.

text: Alice: Good evening, Professor, I apologize for writing to you on Facebook but I thought that it would be the easiest and quickest way to contact you. Kind regards, Alice </s><s> Margaret: Good evening, all classes will take place according to schedule tomorrow, so no good news for the students! :) By the way, I would really prefer if students wrote to me on my email address. </s><s> Alice: I know, I apologize </s><s> Margaret: Ok, just remember in the future. </s><s> Alice: It's just we got used to communicating with Dr. Smith via Facebook, he uses it all the time </s><s> Margaret: I know, Dr. Smith has a very informal approach, however I happen not to share his views. </s><s> Alice: Ok, sorry again, Professor! </s><s> Margaret: You know I only answered here because you are older than your fellow students, had it been one of the others I would have told the rascal to send me a proper email message. ;) </s><s> Alice: I know, I apologize once again </s><s> Margaret: No problem, see you tomorrow! </s><s> Alice: Have a nice evening </s><s> Margaret: You too. </s><s> Alice: Oh and may I ask you one more thing? </s><s> Margaret: I feel like I'm being forcibly Dr. Smith-ized here. </s><s> Alice: Sorry again... </s><s> Margaret: Ok, ok, just ask. </s><s> Alice: May I ask you if you have read the second chapter of my thesis? I hope it's good but I'm not sure... </s><s> Margaret: I haven't read all of it yet but it's pretty good so far. I will send you more feedback over the weekend, ok? </s><s> Alice: Ok, thank you very much, Professor! </s><s> Margaret: You're welcome, just use email next time, please. </s><s> Alice: I will! Kind regards </s><s> Margaret: That sounded strange in a messenger chat, but ok. Yours faithfully! </s><s> Alice: Good night, Professor :) </s><s> Margaret: Good night, Alice!
summary: Margaret is going to teach her classes tomorrow according to schedule. Margaret prefers that students write her messages on her e-mail address instead of Facebook. Margaret hasn't read the whole 2nd chapter of  Alice's thesis yet, but thinks it's good so far.

text: Patricia: Barry!! Have you heard the news? They released a demo gameplay from Cyberpunk 2077! </s><s> Barry: What, really? I guess we'll see when the game gets released but for once the NPCs seemed like real people, even the crowds. I can't wait!! </s><s> Barry: It's only a shame about the POV... </s><s> Patricia: You don't like first-person? </s><s> Barry: Well, I guess it's okay at times but I'd prefer over-the-shoulder. They say you can customise everything about your character so I'd kind of like to be able to see my gear because otherwise what's the point. </s><s> Patricia: Huh... I actually haven't played first-person much, but I ended up really enjoying it in Morrowind. It felt really immersive and when I switched to third-person view for a moment, it felt strange. </s><s> Barry: Well, I'll still be hoping for an option to switch to third-person... </s><s> Patricia: I wouldn't really count on that. They seem really committed to their vision and think this is the best choice so people can enjoy the world 100%. </s><s> Barry: I'm still not sure but y'know, not gonna hate until it's actually release. It looks really good so far so I'd be happy if they proved me wrong and made me enjoy the POV. </s><s> Patricia: I just wish they'd tell us the release date already! </s><s> Barry: Hmm, who knows... I think it was supposed to be ready this year, so I'm keeping my fingers crossed.
summary: There was a demo gameplay from Cyberpunk 2077 released. Barry and Patricia like it and can't wait to play the game. Barry prefers over-the-shoulder view to first-person.

text: Matty: Happy Christmas!! :D hope you're enjoying the festivities </s><s> Ella: Thanks Matty!! Merry Christmas to you too ;) How are you??? :D </s><s> Matty: I'm good thank you just sleepy haha :) how about you? </s><s> Matty: How's things going with studying </s><s> Ella: Oh dear :P What have you been up to? ;) I'm not that sleepy, even though I did get to bed late :P </s><s> Ella: Uni's hard work (no changes there), but I really like my subjects this semester - on of my subjects is Microbiology (so all on bacteria), another is on the Biochemical Pathways to Metabolic Illnesses (basically diabetes and obesity) - so, pretty cool stuff :D </s><s> Ella: WHat about you? Are you having fun? </s><s> Matty: Sounds interesting I've gotta say. Particularly the bacteria stuff! I've been on a walk today so quite tired from that. And I'm enjoying uni yeah! Very very busy. Starting dissertation stuff soon and had a lot of work for essays </s><s> Ella: Did you take any photos whilst on your walk? :D So... what does your dissertation stuff look like? Are you in any Uni groups? </s><s> Matty: Got some yeah :) posted one to Facebook. Mine is looking like geography and politics related. Not sure about uni groups? What's your dissertation on if you have to do one? </s><s> Ella: We don't really have dissertations... at the end of my third year I'll be writing my degree, so that will be like a slightly longer lab report :) Geography and politics - hmmm... that's  a pretty wide topic, I mean, you could talk about Global warming etc. right? </s><s> Matty: Aah ok. So the long report is a big part of your degree and counts a lot towards it? </s><s> Matty: And it's very wide the topic. Can talk about that yes, can also do social and cultural stuff too in there </s><s> Ella: Yeah, basically my grades and my report make up my degree :) Social and cultural stuff... like what? </s><s> Matty: Aaah cool :D I have exams too which make mine up haha. Lucky you </s><s> Matty: And stuff like social separation and classes and how everything plays into each other and culture is like heritage and what matters to different people </s><s> Ella: I meant grades from exams, so I don't know if I'm really that lucky :P That's actually really interesting! So how do you prepare for this? Do you get to interview people? </s><s> Matty: Oh right haha. And I have to do loads of reading and prepare some fieldwork. And I likely will have to inerview people yeah. What kind of things do you do in the lab? </s><s> Ella: Depends on your field of study - I'm doing Embriology, so I basically conduct experiments on mouse oocytes that should hopefully give some decent results. But other people can grow bacteria on petri dishes if they're doing Microbiology, or study particular fragments of DNA if they're doing Genetics </s><s> Ella: It really depends on what you're studying - Biology has a pretty large spectrum, afterall :)
summary: Ella and Matty are both busy with the workload at university. Ella is studying biology and enjoys it very much. Matty is into geography and politics.

text: Julie: Can you give me some ideas for Christmas movies, please? </s><s> Ramsay: Well, there's Home Alone. </s><s> Julie: Oh, right! </s><s> Ramsay: The Lethal Weapon films all had Christmas in them! </s><s> Julie: Not exactly what I mean, but... </s><s> Ramsay: How about National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation? summary: Ramsay recommends to Julie the following Christmas movies: Home Alone, The Lethal Weapon, National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation, Nightmare Before Christmas, the Santa Clause films with Tim Allen as Santa, Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer, The Year Without a Santa Claus.

summary: Anna hasn't contacted anyone since 12 October. Mila and Wyatt are worried because Anna had some health issues and was depressed when Mila saw her last time. Mila talked to Anna's father and he said Anna warned him she's going to disappear for a few weeks.

text: Michaela: So what do you guys think about the association idea? </s><s> Ron: I might be lacking the context here </s><s> Michaela: Basically we were thinking of turning the club into an official association, so it's easier to get funds for events for example </s><s> Jessie: I'm torn actually - I get why it would help with funds, cooperation with other institutions and such, but I researched it and it involves quite a bit of paperwork. </s><s> Steve: And someone to take care of it permanently, cause it doesn't end at setting up the association - you have to do it every year. </s><s> Michaela: These are exactly the kind of things that I wanted to discuss with you. Do we have anyone willing to take care of the paperwork? Doesn't have to be one person. </s><s> Steve: Frankly, I don't see anyone doing this - we all have jobs, barely have time for meetings sometimes and it's a ton of responsibility </s><s> Ron: The question is - do the profits of being an association surpass the costs - like the amount of time and work we put into it? There are also some financial costs, are there? </s><s> Michaela: yeah, like a small fee when you set it up, but nothing more really. </s><s> Jessie: so what do we get from it really? </s><s> Michaela: maybe the cost of a rubber stamp. </s><s> Michaela: for example here are subsidies the city gives out every year, but to apply you need to be a formal association <file_other> </s><s> Ron: and there was this time when that community center refused to work with us, because we weren't an association </s><s> Jessie: I think there were two times we were rejected cause of that actually </s><s> Michaela: I recall two as well </s><s> Steve: but do we truly need those subsidies? We've worked for almost 4 years without them and for me that was the beauty of it - that you can organize events without spending tons of money on it, just with collective effort. </s><s> Steve: I'm just afraid we're gonna lose this sense of an informal get-together, it's all just gonna turn into a business and will create tensions between us. I've seen it happen to clubs like ours </s><s> Ron: it's not necessarily going to happen to us and we could make some better events with more funding </s><s> Michaela: association is not a business, we're not gonna start selling things. It's just about access to the possibilities that's we're denied right now cause we're not a formal association </s><s> Jessie: well... I could help out with the paperwork, but not alone. I'd say 2 more people would be enough to make this work </s><s> Michaela: as this was my idea, I can help too, just a matter of dividing our work properly </s><s> Ron: I can't take up additional responsibilities right now with all that's been going on, so I won't be able to help, buy if y'all agree it's a good idea, I'm going to support it </s><s> Michaela: Steve? </s><s> Steve: I don't know man, I like things the way they are right now </s><s> Michaela: Ok, maybe it's better to talk about this in person. Is Monday after the meeting ok for you all? </s><s> Steve: yup, I can stay a bit longer </s><s> Jessie: Fine by me </s><s> Ron: as well
summary: Michaela proposed turning the club into an official association, which involves additional responsibilities, but also gives new possibilities. Jessie is not sure, but might help with the paperwork. Steve is oppose to the idea. Michaela, Jessie, Steve and Ron will discuss it in person on Monday.

summary: Jody hates ironing, especially her husband's shirts. She irons them because last time he did it, he burnt her favourite shirt and two of his own. Lynn suggests buying an ironing machine. Jody will visit her tomorrow around 2:00 to see how it works.

text: Helena: Hi Wanda, how is Uni going? </s><s> Wanda: Pretty well, but the deadlines are doing my head in, so much fucking work! </s><s> Helena: I see you've started swearing like a typical student! My language got really bad last year! </s><s> Wanda: Yeah, I remember! I was shocked, but everyone does it here! </s><s> Helena: Here too, only with Scottish accent as well, it did take me a few months to get used to it! </s><s> Wanda: You're a lot braver than me, I only went about 15 miles to Leeds. </s><s> Helena: Yep, you didn't move out of West Yorks even! </s><s> Wanda: Well, I prefer it! I can even go and work in the petrol station till 10pm and pop home on the late train if I want to, saves me food money to have a day or two of home cooking, plus it's a lot nicer. </s><s> Helena: I know what you mean! I can't be arsed to peel veg and stuff like that, I exist on take aways and convenience micro meals, not good! </s><s> Wanda: Have you got I to the famous Scottish deep fried Mars bar craze? </s><s> Helena: 🤣I have had one, but Edinburgh is a bit posher than Glasgow where it's more popular. Do like square sausage and cloutie dumpling, though! </s><s> Wanda: You'll have to initiate me into these delicacies when I come visit. </s><s> Helena: You bet! When can you make it?  </s><s> Wanda: Well, I have two days off lectures at the end of next week and I can swap my shifts around if I do it tomorrow. I reckon I can train it up next Thurs if that suits you. </s><s> Helena: Should be fine! I have got lectures Friday mind, you could try a bit of sightseeing, perhaps? </s><s> Wanda: I would love to see the Castle and the National Art Gallery, have a wee look round too, hen! </s><s> Helena: Don't start trying to act all Scottish, you sassenach! </s><s> Wanda: Not sure what that means, but you're a Yorkshire lass too and you do it! </s><s> Helena: Yes, but I'm an adopted Scottish person now. I'd really like to stay on here, maybe do a PGCE. </s><s> Wanda: You a teacher! You haven't got the bloody patience to deal with kids all day! </s><s> Helena: Maybe, but it's an idea I've been toying with, convey my passion for history to the young! </s><s> Wanda: Hopefully, the young will share your enthusiasm! </s><s> Helena: Well, we'll see, still got over a year to decide! </s><s> Wanda: Think about it carefully, my sister teaches Geography over in Brighouse, as you know. She's only been doing it 3 years and she feels burnt out at the end of term! </s><s> Helena: Oh yeah, forgot about that! Anyway, keep me posted about next weekend, can't wait to see you if you can manage it! </s><s> Wanda: Me too, bye Chuck! </s><s> Helena: Bye 😗!
summary: Wanda's uni is going pretty well. She studies in Leeds. She's going to visit Helena next Thursday. Helena is considering becoming a history teacher.

text: Lisha: Hey, my computer's dead.  </s><s> Rasha: What happened?  </s><s> Lisha: don't know, one second I was working and then I got a blue screen and it said "dumping memory" </s><s> Rasha: Can't be good. text: Tiffany: Who's Elon Musk? </s><s> Blair: You know nothin', John Snow. </s><s> Dale: Srsly? He's creating the first passenger shuttle to the moon. </s><s> Tiffany: Rly? :) How much is the ticket? </s><s> Dale: Depends. Currently around $ 35 mil.  </s><s> Tiffany: What? </s><s> Blair: Rly. Unfortunately, that kinda cash doesn't fit into my piggy bank.  </s><s> Dale: Bt the good news is that you'll be able to watch it using VR! </s><s> Tiffany: How?! </s><s> Blair: Apparently they're going to stream the whole thing in HD via their satellites.  </s><s> Tiffany: Wow! Amazing! When? </s><s> Dale: No one really knows. When they finally build the shuttle and set off, but the date is not known for now. </s><s> Tiffany: Shame. Maybe until then I'll manage to buy myself this VR headset ;)  </s><s> Blair: You really should! If not for work, you can always use it for pleasure :) </s><s> Dale: Just don't play horror games. You'll get a heart attack. </s><s> Tiffany: Really that scary? </s><s> Dale: Tried it once. Nevermind the money. I'm not doing it again.  </s><s> Blair: Someone got scared? ;) </s><s> Dale: But all other games are fine. And the experiences are unspeakable! </s><s> Blair: I do confirm that. When you put on the headset it's a little awkward at first, but when you forget about it, virtual reality becomes reality. </s><s> Tiffany: Where can I buy this? </s><s> Dale: The easiest way? Online.  </s><s> Blair: Remeber, it's not cheap.  </s><s> Dale: <file_other> <file_other> <file_other> <file_other> <file_other> There you go. </s><s> Tiffany: Cheap is not the word that best describes it. </s><s> Blair: But it's worth it ;)
summary: Elon Musk set up PayPal, Tesla and SpaceX and is s creating the first passenger shuttle to the moon. The tickets cost around $ 35 million, but the event is going to be streamed in HD via satelites. The date is yet unknown. Tiffany wants to buy a VR headset.

text: Leu: How are you? Any new development about the house? </s><s> Luisa: Hello my dear!  Sadly not. No news at all regarding the house :(( We'll be sitting on it till the end of our lives! </s><s> Leu: That can't be. It is such a fantastic property. In such an incredibly beautiful estate. It's a matter of time. </s><s> Luisa: That's what we thought last spring when we put it on the market. </s><s> Leu: It took me 2 years to sell my flat back in Poland. </s><s> Luisa: Oh well... Wait and see. The last prospective buyers we had, 5 weeks back, were so enthusiastic we'd thought we're done. They said ours was shortlisted, their favourite in Ballito, but they still wanted to check another estate. And that was it. She didn't even bother to phone, just sent me a minimal message. Bill got so frustrated that he drank himself stiff that night. </s><s> Leu: He does it from time to time, doesn't he? </s><s> Luisa: From time to time? Regularly!!! Can't you remember?! </s><s> Leu: Not quite. Never saw him really tight. </s><s> Luisa: Cause you used to leave before his evening was over. I'm seriously worried about his health, to tell you the truth. It's just every day that he tipples. </s><s> Leu: As if slowly killing himself with liquor. </s><s> Luisa: He doesn't care. He says he's got his life behind him. </s><s> Leu: But it is terrible. How can you cope with it? </s><s> Luisa: I stopped to care too. It is his life. If he wants to put a quicker end to it, it's up to him. Look I cannot do anything about it. What hide bottles? Just don't want to have an invalid in my house one day. </s><s> Leu: Therapy? </s><s> Luisa: Gimme a break! Can you imagine Bill attending an AA therapy like a good boy! I can't. </s><s> Leu: Nor can I. </s><s> Luisa: We even stopped talking about his drinking problem long ago. When he started, just after and because of his early retirement, I thought I'd better refrain from commenting because he's so depressed. But then it was worse and worse... Now it's too late. </s><s> Leu: Poor Luisa, poor Bill. It is so sad. But you are tough Luisa. You are so incredibly tough and strong and even-tempered, I'd say. </s><s> Luisa: Yes, I am. That keeps me sane. I don't worry if I can't change it. To a degree... </s><s> Leu: Right you are! "The beach scape changes every month as tides bring in tons of sand and cover the rocks making the beach appear totally different." Do you remember? </s><s> Luisa: "Then the rocks are laid bare as the tide pulls away the sand. Such is life."
summary: Luisa has had no luck selling her house yet. It took Leu 2 year to sell his apartment. Bill has a drinking problem. Luisa has stopped trying to help Bill.

text: Doris: Hello Jill, my ultra-fit sister, 3 years my senior, had a heart attack early on Tuesday morning. I visited her in hospital the past 2 days and she mending well. She has had 2 stents fitted. </s><s> Jill: Oh Doris! So sorry! But good news she is on the mend. Miracles of medicine. </s><s> Doris: This has given the family a great shock as she was so well. She walked a 21 km marathon on Sunday. </s><s> Jill: Did she strain her heart during the walk? </s><s> Doris: We don't know, but there is also sign of an injury a long while ago. It worries me that there was no warning. </s><s> Jill: It is worrying that we can't see what's getting weaker within us. No warnings as you say. How does she take it emotionally? </s><s> Doris: She is quite strong. </s><s> Jill: Good! You too I hope? </s><s> Doris: Yes, absolutely. </s><s> Jill: Keep it up! Where is she? </s><s> Doris: Pietermaritzburg </s><s> Jill: How long do you have to drive there? </s><s> Doris: 1.5 hours off peak traffic. </s><s> Jill: Not so bad. Will you be driving to see her soon? </s><s> Doris: Dunno yet. Her condition is stable. She's got her husband and 3 children around her. But I may go and stay with her when she's back home. </s><s> Jill: To help with the household? </s><s> Doris: Exactly. But it may be that they'll first send her for recuperation somewhere. </s><s> Jill: They usually do after a serious operation, don't they? </s><s> Doris: That would be very good for her indeed. Also mentally. She's strong but her body may need a rest. We'll see! </s><s> Jill: I'll keep fingers crossed for you! Both of you. </s><s> Doris: Thx Jill. You never know what helps :)) </s><s> Jill: Take care my friend! </s><s> Doris: You too.
summary: Doris' sister had a heart attack on Tuesday and is recovering in hospital after having 2 stents fitted. Generally the sister is very fit, she walked a 21 km marathon on Sunday. She's in Pietermaritzburg, with her husband and 3 children around. Doris may stay with her and help once she's back home.
